an8.73:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika in the brick house.
an8.73:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an8.73:4.6: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of death is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial. It culminates in the deathless and ends with the deathless.
an8.73:4.7: But do you develop mindfulness of death?”
an8.73:5.1: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha:
an8.73:5.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:5.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for another day and night, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:5.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:6.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an8.73:6.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:6.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:6.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for another day, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:6.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:7.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an8.73:7.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:7.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:7.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for half a day, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:7.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.
an8.73:8.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an8.73:8.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:8.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:8.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to eat a meal of alms-food, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:8.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.
an8.73:9.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an8.73:9.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:9.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:9.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to eat half a meal of alms-food, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:9.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.
an8.73:10.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an8.73:10.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:10.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:10.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:10.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:11.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an8.73:11.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:11.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:11.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:11.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:12.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an8.73:12.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:12.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an8.73:12.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an8.73:12.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an8.73:13.1: When this was said, the Buddha said to those mendicants:
an8.73:13.2: “The mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing
an8.73:13.3: to live for a day and night …
an8.73:13.5: or to live for a day …
an8.73:13.7: or to live for half a day …
an8.73:13.9: or to live as long as it takes to eat a meal of alms-food …
an8.73:13.11: or to live as long as it takes to eat half a meal of alms-food …
an8.73:13.13: or to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls …
an8.73:13.14: These are called mendicants who live negligently. They slackly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.
an8.73:14.1: But the mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing
an8.73:14.2: to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful …
an8.73:14.4: or to live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out …
an8.73:14.5: These are called mendicants who live diligently. They keenly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.
an8.73:15.1: So you should train like this:
an8.73:15.2: ‘We will live diligently. We will keenly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.’
